subject: p16662264
Findings: The heart is normal in size. The mediastinal and hilar contours appear within normal limits. Pleural effusions have resolved. There is a patchy new opacity in the lateral segment of the right middle lobe, worrisome for pneumonia. However, elsewhere, the lungs appear clear. The osseous structures are unremarkable.
Impression: New opacity in the right middle lobe suggesting pneumonia in the appropriate clinical setting.
